comments: Good professor, always leave class feeling like you\'ve learned something. He posts his slides online but without him there to explain it can become quite difficult so you\'re best going to class. If you go to class, pay attention, take notes you\'ll do fine. He also has a good sense of humor

comments: Worst prof I\'ve ever had. Extremely boring, lectures aren\'t useful. The book is pretty much your only teacher, he\'s often late or cancelled class last minute, he lost my first 3 tests along with 15 other students (didn\'t even apologize) & didn\'t find them until I asked him 5 times before going to the dean & we only got them back after the V.W date.

stu_tags: GET READY TO READ  CARING  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA
comments: Read the textbook before class make notes on those chapters. Go to class to write notes on his lecture slides. His slides were too dumbied down. if u were to miss a class - he has the slides posted on nexus after the lecture < however, the amount of pics + lack of info sometimes makes it difficult to understand whats going on. tests are easy/weird

comments: He\'s okay. Talks a lot about philosophy, which I don\'t care about. I find his slides to be a bit unorganized but as long as you study the definitions from the textbook and the slide notes you\'ll do fine. Usually posts slides right after class. Lectures can get boring.

comments: I gave it a harder rating because it was condensed. I dont enjoy Lees instructing. His teaching methods are odd. His communication skills disappoint and can come off condescending at times. No luck asking for help outside of the class room either and he wouldnt stop telling us how "crazy" we were for taking it during the spring - we cant handle it.

comments: I took this class as a spring course so everything was jammed into 6 weeks but it was still do-able. Had to read the entire textbook over the class so its mandatory to have it. Great prof, very easy to listen to and never felt afraid to ask questions, would definitely recommend

comments: I found Dr Lee\'s lectures to be insightful. He delivers the material in a manner that is not too difficult to understand. There is a lot of info, but it is manageable. He knows his stuff well. Tests were rather difficult to study for because the text and lecture material quite is different.

comments: I had Mike for intro psych last year and decided to take developmental psych with him this year. I regretted it. He teaches a lot of antiquated/potentially offensive ideas like that ADHD is a fake disorder that people made up for money. I really lost a lot of respect for the prof by taking this course.

comments: The notes are all online, as long as you read the notes you\'ll be fine. He does clarify some points in the lecture, but all-in-all if you read the chapters in the textbook and on Nexus, you\'ll be fine. All around, he\'s a pretty nice guy.

stu_tags: CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA  HILARIOUS  AMAZING LECTURES
comments: Mike Lee was a solid teacher. He is very organized and very straight forward to what you need to know. As long as you read the material, going to & listening during lectures really helps you get a better grasp on the certain key concepts and definitions. He also posts the notes online and gives you practice exams which come in handy.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (14)  Clear grading criteria (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Amazing lectures (3)  Hilarious (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  Caring (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Quite boring to listen too. Shows lots of visuals and info in slides though, most of everything is a copy and paste of the slides and textbook, but will mention from time to time of things worth writing down for tests. Vary hard to reach outside of class. Besides being underwhelming he\'s a good choice if you want easy enough.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (14)  Clear grading criteria (5)  LECTURE HEAVY (4)  Amazing lectures (3)  Hilarious (3)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Respected (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  Caring (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Tough Grader (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Very casual. Slides have lots of visual aids and he goes into lots of examples, which left me feeling like not a lot of ground was covered for an intro class. Makes sure to explain something until everyone understands it however. pulled a no-show once or twice. Exams are comprehensive and often have to do with details from textbook.
